Under the Tax Act, a tax benefit is a “tax benefit” for the taxable years in which it is a benefit. This is consistent with the Tax Act's definition of “tax benefit” as a “net benefit,” defined as “an amount that is taxable for purposes of the tax laws of the United States or other countries and for which a tax is imposed by the Internal Revenue Code of 1954.”
